body: Oh come on this is so ridiculous. That's not even what it says and Paul didn't write that passage anyway. I don't understand why you are bothering to jump through so many hoops for excuses to act like a Pharisee. And I also don't get the particular obsession with something the bible mentions less than 5 times.
body_html: Oh come on this is so ridiculous. That's not even what it says and Paul didn't write that passage anyway. I don't understand why you are bothering to jump through so many hoops for excuses to act like a Pharisee. And I also don't get the particular obsession with something the bible mentions less than 5 times.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
> Now having said that, and assuming she does not rebel, i would expect and advise her to be a wife, and to not pursue vain "careers" but rather to marry a man and raise a family of her own in the love of God.

Jesus would disagree with you, read Matthew 19:12. Paul would also take issues with this compulsory marriage doctrine, check out 1 Corinthians 7.

parent.body:
Yes, and does my answer not apply?

As for what other people say, 99% of the time they are misinformed, and even when they are more or less right, they still word the thing poorly.

I raise my daughter to be physically capable, and i teach her math as well as science.  Having said that, i will raise her primarily as a Christian, to the extent that she continue in the faith of Jesus Christ, forcing nothing on her except my love towards her.

Now having said **that**, and assuming she does not rebel, i would expect and advise her to be a wife, and to not pursue vain "careers" but rather to marry a man and raise a family of her own in the love of God.

This does not mean that she can't do anything, but it also does not mean she can do anything.  Our capacity to do anything means nothing in light of what makes most sense for us to do, and what will be best for us in the long run.
parent.body_html:
Yes, and does my answer not apply?

As for what other people say, 99% of the time they are misinformed, and even when they are more or less right, they still word the thing poorly.

I raise my daughter to be physically capable, and i teach her math as well as science. Having said that, i will raise her primarily as a Christian, to the extent that she continue in the faith of Jesus Christ, forcing nothing on her except my love towards her.

Now having said that, and assuming she does not rebel, i would expect and advise her to be a wife, and to not pursue vain "careers" but rather to marry a man and raise a family of her own in the love of God.

This does not mean that she can't do anything, but it also does not mean she can do anything. Our capacity to do anything means nothing in light of what makes most sense for us to do, and what will be best for us in the long run.

body: The only thing girls can't do as well as boys is play sports, because they have less strength and less physio-spatial awareness. And even that doesn't always matter because they don't compete against boys in the first place. Pretty much everything else girls will always be way better at than boys, because they have more brain power. They are not the expendable machines who sacrifice themselves to work and fight so they don't have to give up their personal development. The reason so many men say the opposite is because we're extremely jealous, but we also like to be proud and show no weakness so most of us won't admit it.
body_html: The only thing girls can't do as well as boys is play sports, because they have less strength and less physio-spatial awareness. And even that doesn't always matter because they don't compete against boys in the first place. Pretty much everything else girls will always be way better at than boys, because they have more brain power. They are not the expendable machines who sacrifice themselves to work and fight so they don't have to give up their personal development. body: No, the Christian order is Christ -> everyone else, not this pagan nuclear family ideal that has never even been achieved. I don't care what the church fathers wrote under Paul's and Peter's names, heck I don't care if Paul and Peter did really say that because they'd be wrong anyway (but it's pretty obvious it wasn't them). Look in the gospels. Jesus said to be as little children. Countless stories of people being told to leave their biological family behind for the spiritual brotherhood, in which there are to be no divisions, not Jew or Greek, not slave or free, not male and female. Being a eunuch called greater than marriage. I know it's tempting to think that if we could just return to some grand ideal like this one, all the major problems in the world would be instantly solved. But that's not how it works, and life in this world is just rotten regardless and considered broken and temporary. Trying to strive and "fix society" like worldly people do is a vain effort and only creates more problems than it solves.
body_html: No, the Christian order is Christ -> everyone else, not this pagan nuclear family ideal that has never even been achieved. I don't care what the church fathers wrote under Paul's and Peter's names, heck I don't care if Paul and Peter did really say that because they'd be wrong anyway (but it's pretty obvious it wasn't them). Look in the gospels. Jesus said to be as little children. Countless stories of people being told to leave their biological family behind for the spiritual brotherhood, in which there are to be no divisions, not Jew or Greek, not slave or free, not male and female. Being a eunuch called greater than marriage. I know it's tempting to think that if we could just return to some grand ideal like this one, all the major problems in the world would be instantly solved. But that's not how it works, and life in this world is just rotten regardless and considered broken and temporary. Trying to strive and "fix society" like worldly people do is a vain effort and only creates more problems than it solves.

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: The reason is that the bible has been edited by scribes who often inserted pagan or demonic doctrines into it. Characters in the oldest bible stories do not seem to be aware of most of the Jewish laws, even the super-important ones. Much of the law books are fake, the brutal genocides probably weren't real, and a myriad of other stuff. God specifically calls out animal sacrifices and likely the laws saying to burn people alive when speaking to Jeremiah (Jeremiah 7). In the next chapter (8) he says: "How can you say 'we are wise, and the law of 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 is with us'? Because in reality the false pen of scribes has written to lie!". And there we have it. They did not have the law of God because they were instead following phony religious texts, many of which were forged completely and others which were factual accounts and heavily edited. Nevertheless, they should've known his real law in their heart (8:4-7). It's interesting to note that this prophecy occurs shortly after a very strange story in which Josiah's priests "find" a book of law in the temple. That's very odd to misplace such holy words so easily, or only have one copy of them. Especially when it was found to contain everything in support of Josiah's reforms just in time for him to implement them, and it conveniently depicts him ultra favorably and gives him more power.
body_html: The reason is that the bible has been edited by scribes who often inserted pagan or demonic doctrines into it. Characters in the oldest bible stories do not seem to be aware of most of the Jewish laws, even the super-important ones. Much of the law books are fake, the brutal genocides probably weren't real, and a myriad of other stuff. God specifically calls out animal sacrifices and likely the laws saying to burn people alive when speaking to Jeremiah (Jeremiah 7). In the next chapter (8) he says: "How can you say 'we are wise, and the law of 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 is with us'? Because in reality the false pen of scribes has written to lie!". And there we have it. They did not have the law of God because they were instead following phony religious texts, many of which were forged completely and others which were factual accounts and heavily edited. Nevertheless, they should've known his real law in their heart (8:4-7). It's interesting to note that this prophecy occurs shortly after a very strange story in which Josiah's priests "find" a book of law in the temple. That's very odd to misplace such holy words so easily, or only have one copy of them. Especially when it was found to contain everything in support of Josiah's reforms just in time for him to implement them, and it conveniently depicts him ultra favorably and gives him more power.

parent.body:
you can be good without god.  god is a generic name for something we don't understand and some of the names for god in Hebrew attest to this....the name is 'the unknowable'. The concept is similar to when Muslims prohibit showing images of god - humans tend to worship images and put to much focus on texts when all that is in the world could never ever fit in one book and so the book is a rough guide only.  There is another Hebrew name for god, I think , 'the unspeakable name'...and that is also similar to the concept of showing no image- because humans pretend like they know everything about god and try to say god wants this or that.  Sometimes what they say is close to truth, but other times they are conning people.
The god of the bible was a shithead and killed more people than satan or Lucifer and god supposedly created satan and lucifer.  the bible is a collection of stories written by many people and isn't to be taken as hard fact, but merely as a rough guide...things to deeply consider. same with other holy texts.
parent.body_html: you can be good without god. god is a generic name for something we don't understand and some of the names for god in Hebrew attest to this....the name is 'the unknowable'. The concept is similar to when Muslims prohibit showing images of god - humans tend to worship images and put to much focus on texts when all that is in the world could never ever fit in one book and so the book is a rough guide only. There is another Hebrew name for god, I think , 'the unspeakable name'...and that is also similar to the concept of showing no image- because humans pretend like they know everything about god and try to say god wants this or that. Sometimes what they say is close to truth, but other times they are conning people. The god of the bible was a shithead and killed more people than satan or Lucifer and god supposedly created satan and lucifer. the bible is a collection of stories written by many people and isn't to be taken as hard fact, but merely as a rough guide...things to deeply consider. same with other holy texts.

post.body:
Jesus | Modern Christians
--- | ---
The most important thing is to love God and your neighbor as yourself | The most important thing is "family values" and conservative politics
Worship God alone | Worship "God", but only after Trump, our politicians, tv preachers, America, the founding fathers, Greco-Roman traditions, the church fathers, the bible, Paul, Peter, John, James, David, Solomon, and Moses
The worst evil is rejecting the Holy Spirit | The worst sin is being gay
Care for the poor and imprisoned | Hoard your wealth
Being a eunuch is a high honor | Anyone not part of a suburban household with a working father, a housewife, and 2.5 kids is a threat
Love your enemy and forgive those who wrong you, and turn the other cheek | Hate your enemy and seek revenge on people you don't like
Judge not, lest you be judged | Judge others as much as possible, especially outsiders
Humble yourself and be meek | Meekness is weakness, boast about yourself and your strength, and your piety
Women are people | Women are pieces of meat and objects created for sexual pleasure
Don't make up silly rules | Follow only manmade rules: go to church, no women wearing pants, no disagreeing with the pastor, etc.
Evangelize to the lost | Reject the lost and smear your righteousness, and gatekeep salvation
Do good deeds in secret | Do good deeds to be seen by others
Everything but rejecting the Holy Spirit will be forgiven | Everything will be forgiven EXCEPT the things we don't like
The human heart is naturally evil since the fall | We should return to the glorious ages of the past
Look forward to the new creation | Focus on fixing everything in this life and saving society
The spiritual family transcends all divisions and lasts forever. Call no man master or father | Biological family, especially the nuclear family, is supreme. Life roles based on biological attributes are of utmost importance.

This is just off the top of my head, there are plenty of other issues. Be careful and guard against the false teachings, because they are extremely prevalent.

Jesus Modern Christians

The worst evil is rejecting the Holy Spirit The worst sin is being gay

Love your enemy and forgive those who wrong you, and turn the other cheek Hate your enemy and seek revenge on people you don't like
Judge not, lest you be judged Judge others as much as possible, especially outsiders
Humble yourself and be meek Meekness is weakness, boast about yourself and your strength, and your piety
Women are people Women are pieces of meat and objects created for sexual pleasure
Don't make up silly rules Follow only manmade rules: go to church, no women wearing pants, no disagreeing with the pastor, etc.
Evangelize to the lost Reject the lost and smear your righteousness, and gatekeep salvation
Do good deeds in secret Do good deeds to be seen by others
Everything but rejecting the Holy Spirit will be forgiven Everything will be forgiven EXCEPT the things we don't like
The human heart is naturally evil since the fall We should return to the glorious ages of the past
Look forward to the new creation Focus on fixing everything in this life and saving society
The spiritual family transcends all divisions and lasts forever. Call no man master or father Biological family, especially the nuclear family, is supreme. Life roles based on biological attributes are of utmost importance.

This is just off the top of my head, there are plenty of other issues. Be careful and guard against the false teachings, because they are extremely prevalent.

body:
> A few issues though, Jesus states that we should actually judge others, but do it with a righteous judgement and not by appearances (John 7:24). I take that to mean give people the benefit of the doubt and judge them by their actions. But judge with a spirit to help and correct, not to condemn.

Not to judge, but to correct, to advise. That doesn't really translate to judging as we would think of it.

> Also looking forward to a new creation does not mean we should not also be good stewards of the one they have now. If we view this world as a gift, should we not cherish it, look after and repair it? Or should we act like spoiled kids who can trash a new toy because we know mummy will buy us a new one next week?

Everything in this world is vanity. Trying to "save society" is in vain and just creates more problems than it solves. Especially since it's 99% of the time rooted in the wrong motives. Store your treasure in heaven.

> The one that I agree is in the Bible, but is most troubling for me to understand, is the rejection of the Holy Spirit being the greatest evil. Consider the millions of children that have been abused through the ages within the church. A huge number of these abuse victims then find all church authority distasteful and downright sickening. They understandably reject the church and it's teachings out of hand. Is that rejection truly more evil than the abuse that was perpetrated against them by supposed holy men?

In my opinion the idea that the unevangelized are damned is another false doctrine made up by the cults who hate everyone outside their group. Jesus specifically said that people who do not know are not guilty of sin. This includes people who have been treated with the wrong idea of him by both the media and these fake churches.
body_html:
A few issues though, Jesus states that we should actually judge others, but do it with a righteous judgement and not by appearances (John 7:24). I take that to mean give people the benefit of the doubt and judge them by their actions. But judge with a spirit to help and correct, not to condemn.

Not to judge, but to correct, to advise. That doesn't really translate to judging as we would think of it.

Also looking forward to a new creation does not mean we should not also be good stewards of the one they have now. If we view this world as a gift, should we not cherish it, look after and repair it? Or should we act like spoiled kids who can trash a new toy because we know mummy will buy us a new one next week?

Everything in this world is vanity. Trying to "save society" is in vain and just creates more problems than it solves. Especially since it's 99% of the time rooted in the wrong motives. Store your treasure in heaven.

The one that I agree is in the Bible, but is most troubling for me to understand, is the rejection of the Holy Spirit being the greatest evil. Consider the millions of children that have been abused through the ages within the church. A huge number of these abuse victims then find all church authority distasteful and downright sickening. They understandably reject the church and it's teachings out of hand. Is that rejection truly more evil than the abuse that was perpetrated against them by supposed holy men?

In my opinion the idea that the unevangelized are damned is another false doctrine made up by the cults who hate everyone outside their group. Jesus specifically said that people who do not know are not guilty of sin. This includes people who have been treated with the wrong idea of him by both the media and these fake churches.

parent.body:
Jesus versus modern *American Christianity. Although worldwide Christianity faces a lot of these problems, that are by far more pronounced in American Christianity. Poor, impoverished nations face almost none of these.

A few issues though, Jesus states that we should actually judge others, but do it with a righteous judgement and not by appearances (John 7:24). I take that to mean give people the benefit of the doubt and judge them by their actions. But judge with a spirit to help and correct, not to condemn. 

Also looking forward to a new creation does not mean we should not also be good stewards of the one they have now. If we view this world as a gift, should we not cherish it, look after and repair it? Or should we act like spoiled kids who can trash a new toy because we know mummy will buy us a new one next week?

The one that I agree is in the Bible, but is most troubling for me to understand, is the rejection of the Holy Spirit being the greatest evil. Consider the millions of children that have been abused through the ages within the church. A huge number of these abuse victims then find all church authority distasteful and downright sickening. They understandably reject the church and it's teachings out of hand. Is that rejection truly more evil than the abuse that was perpetrated against them by supposed holy men?

Also looking forward to a new creation does not mean we should not also be good stewards of the one they have now. If we view this world as a gift, should we not cherish it, look after and repair it? Or should we act like spoiled kids who can trash a new toy because we know mummy will buy us a new one next week?

The one that I agree is in the Bible, but is most troubling for me to understand, is the rejection of the Holy Spirit being the greatest evil. Consider the millions of children that have been abused through the ages within the church. A huge number of these abuse victims then find all church authority distasteful and downright sickening. They understandably reject the church and it's teachings out of hand. Is that rejection truly more evil than the abuse that was perpetrated against them by supposed holy men?

parent.body: I'm a non-practicing mainline Protestant with Nietzschean tendencies - and near as I can tell I may be one of the most religious people here. The response you're likely to get to this stuff is a big yawn. People can, and do, interpret scripture in myriad ways anyway. I'm not impressed with your layman's effort. I say this as someone that at one time took this seriously enough that I almost went to divinity school.

The worst evil is rejecting the Holy Spirit | The worst sin is being gay
Care for the poor and imprisoned | Hoard your wealth
Being a eunuch is a high honor | Anyone not part of a suburban household with a working father, a housewife, and 2.5 kids is a threat
Love your enemy and forgive those who wrong you, and turn the other cheek | Hate your enemy and seek revenge on people you don't like
Judge not, lest you be judged | Judge others as much as possible, especially outsiders
Humble yourself and be meek | Meekness is weakness, boast about yourself and your strength, and your piety
Women are people | Women are pieces of meat and objects created for sexual pleasure
Don't make up silly rules | Follow only manmade rules: go to church, no women wearing pants, no disagreeing with the pastor, etc.
Evangelize to the lost | Reject the lost and smear your righteousness, and gatekeep salvation
Do good deeds in secret | Do good deeds to be seen by others
Everything but rejecting the Holy Spirit will be forgiven | Everything will be forgiven EXCEPT the things we don't like
The human heart is naturally evil since the fall | We should return to the glorious ages of the past
Look forward to the new creation | Focus on fixing everything in this life and saving society
The spiritual family transcends all divisions and lasts forever. Call no man master or father | Biological family, especially the nuclear family, is supreme. Life roles based on biological attributes are of utmost importance.

This is just off the top of my head, there are plenty of other issues. Be careful and guard against the false teachings, because they are extremely prevalent.
post.body_html:
Jesus Modern Christians
The most important thing is to love God and your neighbor as yourself The most important thing is "family values" and conservative politics
Worship God alone Worship "God", but only after Trump, our politicians, tv preachers, America, the founding fathers, Greco-Roman traditions, the church fathers, the bible, Paul, Peter, John, James, David, Solomon, and Moses
The worst evil is rejecting the Holy Spirit The worst sin is being gay
Care for the poor and imprisoned Hoard your wealth
Being a eunuch is a high honor Anyone not part of a suburban household with a working father, a housewife, and 2.5 kids is a threat
Love your enemy and forgive those who wrong you, and turn the other cheek Hate your enemy and seek revenge on people you don't like
Judge not, lest you be judged Judge others as much as possible, especially outsiders
Humble yourself and be meek Meekness is weakness, boast about yourself and your strength, and your piety
Women are people Women are pieces of meat and objects created for sexual pleasure
Don't make up silly rules Follow only manmade rules: go to church, no women wearing pants, no disagreeing with the pastor, etc.
Evangelize to the lost Reject the lost and smear your righteousness, and gatekeep salvation
Do good deeds in secret Do good deeds to be seen by others
Everything but rejecting the Holy Spirit will be forgiven Everything will be forgiven EXCEPT the things we don't like
The human heart is naturally evil since the fall We should return to the glorious ages of the past
Look forward to the new creation Focus on fixing everything in this life and saving society
The spiritual family transcends all divisions and lasts forever. Call no man master or father Biological family, especially the nuclear family, is supreme. Life roles based on biological attributes are of utmost importance.

This is just off the top of my head, there are plenty of other issues. Be careful and guard against the false teachings, because they are extremely prevalent.
post.title: Jesus vs modern Christianity
